description: Context profile for common problems, fixes, and patterns in the tradeBotServer codebase

jwt_token_expiration.problem: JWT tokens expire causing 500 errors on API calls, especially /api/Order/place
symptoms: 500 Internal Server Error on order placement
Orders fail to place even when credentials are valid
root_causes: Token expires after ~30 minutes but code doesn't auto-refresh
Using expired token in Authorization header
No retry logic with token refresh on 500 errors
Calling authenticate() directly instead of _ensure_valid_token()

solutions.fix: Add automatic token refresh and retry on 500 errors
solutions.code_pattern: if 'error' in response and '500' in str(response.get('error', '')): await self._ensure_valid_token(); await asyncio.sleep(0.75); retry request

solutions.fix: Remove None values from JSON payloads (TopStepX rejects None)
solutions.code_pattern: cleaned_data = {k: v for k, v in data.items() if v is not None}

solutions.fix: Use _ensure_valid_token() instead of authenticate() on startup

prevention: Always use _ensure_valid_token() instead of authenticate() directly
Check token expiration before making API calls
Implement retry logic with token refresh on 500 errors
Add 0.75s delay before retry to prevent rate limiting
Log JSON payloads for debugging order placement issues

async_await_syntax_errors.problem: Using await in synchronous functions causes SyntaxError
symptoms: Line numbers pointing to await statements in sync methods
root_causes: Adding await to synchronous methods like _make_curl_request()
Forgetting to make function async when adding await
Mixing sync and async code incorrectly

solutions.pattern: If method is sync, handle async operations in caller
solutions.example: _make_curl_request() is sync, token refresh happens in async caller

solutions.pattern: Make function async if it needs await

prevention: Check function signature before adding await
If function is 'def', it's sync - handle async in caller
If function is 'async def', it can use await
Clear Python cache files if syntax errors persist: find . -name '*.pyc' -delete

account_tracker_missing_methods.problem: AccountTracker missing get_daily_pnl() method causing strategy failures
symptoms: Strategies fail to analyze: Error analyzing MNQ/MES
root_causes: Strategy code calls tracker.get_daily_pnl() but method doesn't exist
Missing properties: current_balance, daily_loss_limit, etc.

solutions.fix: Add get_daily_pnl() method and required properties

prevention: Ensure AccountTracker implements all methods used by strategies
Check strategy_base.py for required tracker methods
Add properties for commonly accessed state values

signalr_connection_spam.problem: SignalR connection spam causing thousands of failed connection attempts
symptoms: High CPU usage from failed reconnections
root_causes: reconnect_interval: 1 (retry every 1 second)
max_attempts: 0 (unlimited retries)
No exponential backoff
No special handling for 403 errors

solutions.fix: Implement exponential backoff and limit retries
Add 403 error detection to reduce log spam

prevention: Always set max_attempts for reconnection logic
Use exponential backoff for retries
Detect and handle specific error codes (403, 401) specially
Don't log the same error repeatedly

strategy_status_keyerror.problem: strategies status command fails with KeyError: 'status'
root_causes: OvernightRangeStrategy.get_status() overrides base method without calling super()
Missing required fields from base class

solutions.fix: Call super().get_status() first, then add custom fields

prevention: Always call super() when overriding methods
Include all required fields from base class
Test CLI commands after strategy changes

excessive_api_calls.problem: Frontend polling too frequently causing slow dashboard
symptoms: Multiple API calls for same data

solutions.fix: Use balances from list_accounts() instead of individual calls
Add React Query staleTime for better caching

prevention: Use appropriate polling intervals (not too frequent)
Leverage React Query caching
Use WebSocket for real-time updates when possible
Cache API responses on backend

chart_realtime_updates.problem: Chart bars not updating in real-time
symptoms: Bars generated once and never updated
root_causes: Bar aggregator only supports limited timeframes
Frontend too strict about timeframe matching
Bar aggregator not initializing all requested timeframes

solutions.fix: Expand default timeframes to include all chart timeframes
Relax timeframe matching in WebSocket updates

prevention: Initialize all timeframes when symbol is registered
Don't be too strict about timeframe matching
Subscribe to timeframe-specific updates

excessive_logging_verbosity.problem: Terminal output is too verbose with INFO-level logs cluttering the console
symptoms: Terminal flooded with 'Fetching historical data' messages
INFO logs appearing in console during normal operation
root_causes: Both file and console handlers set to same log level (INFO)
No separation between file logging and console output
All INFO logs go to both file and console

solutions.fix: Set console_handler to WARNING level, keep file_handler at INFO level
solutions.code_pattern:
console_handler.setLevel(logging.WARNING)  # Only WARNING+ in terminal
file_handler.setLevel(getattr(logging, log_level, logging.INFO))  # All logs to file

solutions.fix: Add startup message indicating logs go to file
solutions.code_pattern:
print('ℹ️  Detailed logs are being written to: trading_bot.log')
print('   (Terminal will only show warnings and errors)')

prevention: Always separate file and console log levels
File handler should capture all logs (INFO+)
Console handler should only show important messages (WARNING+)
Add startup message to inform users where logs are written
Keep verbose flag to enable full console logging when needed

datetime_utcnow_deprecation.code_pattern:
from datetime import datetime, timezone
# Replace:
datetime.utcnow()
# With:
datetime.now(timezone.utc)
datetime_utcnow_deprecation.prevention: Always use timezone-aware datetime objects. Import timezone from datetime module.

datetime_timezone_mismatch.error: TypeError: can't subtract offset-naive and offset-aware datetimes
symptoms: Error when subtracting two datetime objects
One datetime is timezone-aware, the other is timezone-naive
root_causes: datetime.combine() creates timezone-naive datetime by default
Mixing datetime.now(timezone.utc) with datetime.combine() without tzinfo
Using datetime.utcnow() (naive) with datetime.now(timezone.utc) (aware)
datetime_timezone_mismatch.fix: Ensure both datetimes are timezone-aware when performing arithmetic
datetime_timezone_mismatch.code_pattern:
# Wrong:
now = datetime.now(timezone.utc)  # aware
midnight = datetime.combine(date, time.min)  # naive
result = midnight - now  # ERROR!

# Correct:
now = datetime.now(timezone.utc)  # aware
midnight = datetime.combine(date, time.min, tzinfo=timezone.utc)  # aware
result = midnight - now  # OK!
prevention: Always specify tzinfo when using datetime.combine()
Use datetime.now(timezone.utc) instead of datetime.utcnow()
Ensure all datetime objects in arithmetic operations have the same timezone awareness
Use timezone.utc for UTC operations

common_locations: trading_bot.py line 753 (if added to sync method)
await_outside_async.fix: Move await to async caller or make function async
await_outside_async.prevention: Check function signature before adding await

missing_imports.fix: Add proper imports at top of file
missing_imports.prevention: Use linter to catch missing imports

common_causes: Passing coroutine object instead of callable
type_errors.fix: Ensure functions are callable, not coroutine objects

common_causes: Method renamed but not updated everywhere
attribute_errors.fix: Add missing method or fix object type
attribute_errors.prevention: Use type hints and check object interfaces

common_causes: Overriding method without including all keys
key_errors.fix: Check dictionary keys before access, use .get() with defaults
key_errors.prevention: Always call super() when overriding, validate API responses

avoid: Including None values in JSON payloads to TopStepX API
prefer: Handle async operations in async callers
Remove None values from JSON before sending
Detect and handle specific error codes specially
Log JSON payloads for debugging order issues
Add 0.75s delay before retrying failed requests

token_management: Check token expiration before API calls
Add retry delay (0.75s) to prevent rate limiting
async_programming: Check function signature (def vs async def) before adding await
Handle async operations in async callers
Use asyncio.sleep() for delays in async code
Clear Python cache if syntax errors persist
error_handling: Detect specific error codes (403, 401, 500) and handle specially
Don't log the same error repeatedly
api_integration: Remove None values from JSON payloads
Round prices to tick size before sending
Handle 500 errors with token refresh and retry
strategy_development: Always call super() when overriding methods
Include all required fields from base class
Ensure AccountTracker implements all required methods

critical_methods: _ensure_valid_token() - ASYNC method, use for token management
place_oco_bracket_with_stop_entry() - ASYNC, handles token refresh on 500 errors
_get_contract_id() - Raises ValueError if contracts not available (no hardcoded fallbacks)
common_issues: Remove None from JSON payloads before sending
Contracts must be fetched before use - no hardcoded fallbacks
Always use timezone-aware datetimes for arithmetic operations

migration_notes.rust_migration_priority: High - 9,568 lines, needs refactoring before migration

syntax_errors: Check function signature (def vs async def)
Verify await is only in async functions
api_errors: Verify None values removed from payload
Check for 500 errors and implement token refresh
Add retry delay to prevent rate limiting
strategy_errors: Verify super() is called when overriding
Check all required fields are included

recent_fixes.issue: JWT token expiration causing 500 errors on order placement
recent_fixes.fix: Added automatic token refresh and retry on 500 errors in place_oco_bracket_with_stop_entry()
Added get_daily_pnl() and required properties to AccountTracker

recent_fixes.issue: None values in JSON payloads causing API rejections
recent_fixes.fix: Remove None values from JSON before sending to TopStepX API
Set console handler to WARNING level, keep file handler at INFO level. Added startup message indicating logs go to file.
Replaced all datetime.utcnow() calls with datetime.now(timezone.utc). Updated imports to include timezone from datetime module.

recent_fixes.issue: EOD scheduler error: can't subtract offset-naive and offset-aware datetimes
recent_fixes.fix: Fixed datetime.combine() to include tzinfo=timezone.utc in _eod_scheduler(). Added timezone to local imports.

recent_fixes.issue: SignalR depth subscription errors: Method does not exist (SubscribeOrderBook, SubscribeLevel2)
recent_fixes.fix: Updated _ensure_depth_subscription() to try SubscribeContractDepth first (following SubscribeContractQuotes pattern), suppress expected 'method does not exist' errors, and gracefully fall back to REST API. Changed error logging to debug level for expected failures.

recent_fixes.issue: Hardcoded contract fallbacks causing expired contract issues
recent_fixes.fix: Removed all hardcoded contract mappings. Implemented dynamic contract fetching with automatic selection of most recent/active contract with highest volume. Enhanced symbol extraction from contract IDs and improved error messages.
recent_fixes.impact: Critical - Prevents using expired contracts, ensures always using active contracts

recent_fixes.fix: Added notifications table to PostgreSQL schema and record_notification() method to DatabaseManager. Supports account_id, notification_type, message, level, and optional metadata.

recent_fixes.issue: No comprehensive test suite for all commands
recent_fixes.fix: Created tests/test_all_commands.py - comprehensive test suite that tests all 12+ commands, measures execution times, generates performance reports, and exports JSON results. Achieved 100% success rate on all commands.
recent_fixes.impact: Critical for Rust migration - establishes performance baselines

migration_readiness.current_phase: Phase 2 Complete → Preparing for Phase 4 (Rust Migration)

pre_migration_tasks.details: Split 9,568 line file into modules: core/order_execution.py, core/position_management.py, core/market_data.py, core/risk_management.py
Create rust/ directory with Cargo.toml, src/ structure, tests/, benches/
Install pyo3, create FFI interface, test basic integration
Consolidate duplicate docs, update outdated information, create migration guides

hybrid_architecture_decision.approach: Keep Python for strategies, migrate hot paths to Rust
rationale: Strategies easier to modify in Python
Hot paths benefit from Rust performance
